Posts.Content: I have just recently had a double masectamy DCIS stage 1 with no Lympnodes affected. I too have decided not to take the drug Arimedex... because of all the side effects. I have chose to see a Naturalpath doc ... You can email me personally and I'll fill you in on more ..--Message edited by CancerCompass staff. For personal protection, email address removed. Consider private reply. Please review CancerCompass Member Guidelines at http://www.cancercompass.com/common/guidelines.html-- I think healing your body is the key to fighting anything. Cancer is an aweful diesease and the cure is even worse. My ex is going through chemo ,radiation, drugs and he has not been happy or healthy for two years now. So, no thank you ,... I'll take my chances with God and his strength to guide me along the right path.  The drug scares the hell out of me ... Worse than the diagnoses did.    I wish you the best and please keep me posted on what you decided . My prayers are with you. God Bless
Posts.Title: tempted to refurse all drugs

Posts.Content: Thank you for sharing your information ...what were the treatments you took ? how are you doing today ? when were you diagnosed ? Please respond...
Posts.Title: tempted to refurse all drugs

Posts.Content: Thank you for sharing your information ...what were the treatments you took ? how are you doing today ? when were you diagnosed ? Please respond...
Posts.Title: tempted to refurse all drugs

Posts.Content: Dearest Ookie ,   I am so grateful that we can talk about this . I did notice that they edited my response because I put my email address in it. But you have it now. I have my second consult with the naturalist tonight I will keep you update. I have discovered something I need to share with you . If you look on my personal email I sent you you will find my phone number please call at anytime. That is a cell number and if you have AT&T we can talk for free. If,not send me your number on my personal email and I'll call you ... All we have is each otheres experiences and we need to know all we can so we can learn how to protect ourselves....  You know all the doctors don't know everything that why it is called practicing medicine. Keeping you in my prayers, by the way does ookie mean Oklahoma ? God Bless you ?      On 8/30/2009 ookie wrote:   On 8/27/2009 Ms Babz wrote: I have just recently had a double masectamy DCIS stage 1 with no Lympnodes affected. I too have decided not to take the drug Arimedex... because of all the side effects. I have chose to see a Naturalpath doc ... You can email me personally and I'll fill you in on more ..--Message edited by CancerCompass staff. For personal protection, email address removed. Consider private reply. Please review CancerCompass Member Guidelines at http://www.cancercompass.com/common/guidelines.html-- I think healing your body is the key to fighting anything. Cancer is an aweful diesease and the cure is even worse. My ex is going through chemo ,radiation, drugs and he has not been happy or healthy for two years now. So, no thank you ,... I'll take my chances with God and his strength to guide me along the right path.  The drug scares the hell out of me ... Worse than the diagnoses did.    I wish you the best and please keep me posted on what you decided . My prayers are with you. God Bless Hi Ms. Babz, they took your e-mail out of the context.  I would like to e-mail you .I think we've made the right decision.  mine is jjjkkk890  ya. I spoke with a friend of mine last nite whose friend had a mastectomy 11 years ago and refused all drugs and is doing well.  I had stage 1 DCIS but I had a lumpectomy and a re-excision.   I feel a little nervous about it returning but I know I would be more nervous taking the drugs since the announcement on t.v. about tamoxifen has come out witha 440% higher risk of breast cancer returning.  No matter how I try to talk to myself about the benefits of this category of drugs, it just make no sense at all to take it.  Take care and I too, will be praying for you and your ex. as well, as all the others who were kind enough to e-mail me.
Posts.Title: tempted to refurse all drugs

Posts.Content: Shemay does this help with estrogen driven breast cancer as well... I read the article ,but I'm confused... Please hlep me?
